name: sunlamp
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device that produces ultraviolet light, used for providing a person with vitamin D in winter or helping with the effects of SAD (= a medical condition in which a person does not have much energy and enthusiasm during the winter because of the reduced period of natural light): Gentle use of a sunlamp improved the subjects' vitamin D production significantly. Light therapy involves sitting under bright, artificial light emitted from a sun lamp for about 30 minutes a day. Synonym
light box
/GettyImages
a device that produces ultraviolet light, used for giving someone a suntan (= browner skin): She spends several hours a week under a sunlamp to keep her skin looking tanned. Sunbeds and sun lamps carry a high risk of skin cancer. Compare
sunbed
More examplesFewer examplesFrom the age of 16 she baked under a sunlamp as often as once a week.Mr Blair looked as if he'd been using a sun lamp.Sunbeds and sun lamps do not provide a safe tan.Sun lamps work by imitating sunlight.
